<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/allbirds-becomes-latest-dtc-startup-make-run-public-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Allbirds Takes Flight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/allbirds-becomes-latest-dtc-startup-make-run-public-markets?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Allbirds illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDYwL2FsbGJpcmRzX2lsbHVzdHJhdGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Back in 2017, direct-to-consumer startups flooded your Instagram feed with pastel colors and pledges to “cut out the middleman.” Now, they’ve put on dress slacks and are marching toward Wall Street.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Allbirds, the maker of footwear that’s graced the soles of many a tech bro, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/31/shoe-maker-allbirds-files-for-ipo-and-reveals-continued-losses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> yesterday. The company has made sustainability its core focus, and it plans to continue that mission by putting a green twist on the traditional IPO.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The company is conducting what it calls a </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cc0c5627-0b8e-41b8-a575-7ad94e8c13b6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sustainable Public Equity Offering</a></span><span>, which means it’s holding itself accountable to hit certain environmental, social, and governance (ESG) targets. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Allbirds says its supply chain has been carbon neutral since 2019, and that the carbon footprint of its standard sneakers is 30% less than those of its rivals. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as it tries to steal business from those bigger rivals—namely, Nike and Adidas—it’s worth noting that Allbirds hasn’t made money since it was founded, nor does it envision becoming profitable in the near future. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Sounds familiar</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In that way, and in many others, it’s similar to Warby Parker, the e-commerce eyewear seller that <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/24/warby-parker-in-ipo-filing-reveals-rising-salesbut-also-widening-losses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> last week. Warby is also ditching the classic IPO playbook by going public via direct listing, which means it’s not actually going to raise any money in the process. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both Allbirds and Warby Parker successfully leveraged online channels to attract urban millennials comfortable with buying apparel on the internet. Allbirds’s online sales revenue grew 74% from 2018–2020, and Warby’s total sales jumped 44% over the same period.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as they’ve matured, these brands have found that brick-and-mortar locations are a necessary complement to online shopping.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Warby has opened 145 retail stores as of June 30. Allbirds has 27 and is planning on opening hundreds more. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Allbirds and Warby Parker are just a couple wildebeests in a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-30/hot-ipo-market-is-tough-competition-for-consumer-hungry-buyers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bigger stampede</a> of consumer-facing companies headed to the public markets. Chobani, Sweetgreen, and Roger Federer-backed On Running are all reportedly planning IPOs of their own, hoping to cash in on the strength of the US shopper. <em>– NF</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/hurricane-idas-damage-energy-grid-even-devastating?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hurricane Ida’s Perils Are Just Beginning
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/hurricane-idas-damage-energy-grid-even-devastating?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A huge number of power outages represented by red lines on a map of Southern Louisiana after Hurrican Ida" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDYxL3Bvd2VyX291dGFnZXNfaW5fbG91aXNpYW5hX2FmdGVyX2h1cnJpY2FuZV9pZGEucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Power outages in Southern Louisiana via Entergy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since Ida made landfall as a Category 4 hurricane on Sunday, it’s left <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/08/30/1032549785/heres-the-latest-on-ida-the-tropical-storm-thrashing-the-gulf-coast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1 million</a> homes and businesses on the Gulf Coast without power. Southern Louisiana (pictured above) in particular is reeling from massive outages; it could be weeks before power is back.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened:</strong> The storm <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/entergy-says-2-000-miles-of-high-voltage-lines-knocked-out-by-hurricane-ida-11630370133?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crushed</a> the transmission system that provides most of the energy along the coast. Entergy, a New Orleans-based energy utility, said that as of Monday, 2,000 miles of its transmission lines were out of service, and the Department of Energy said it could take up to three days to fully assess the damage and even begin to repair them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s not just phone batteries at 1% scaring officials.</strong> Without power, homes, businesses, and hospitals in Mississippi and southern Louisiana don’t have safe drinking water, working fridges, or the ability to run air conditioning in the brutal 100-degree heat.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards </span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/570201-louisiana-governor-tells-residents-not-to-return-without-ok-from?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> residents who evacuated before the storm to stay where they are—the state’s emergency systems just can’t handle them right now.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tulane University began </span><span><a href="https://www.chron.com/weather/article/houston-tulane-evacuate-students-hurricane-ida-16425122.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">evacuating</a></span><span> its students to Houston yesterday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How you can help:</strong> Donate to national orgs like <a href="https://give.allhandsandhearts.org/give/355101/?utm_source=morning_brew#!/donation/checkout" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">All Hands and Hearts</a>, or local charities like <a href="https://anothergulf.com/ida/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Another Gulf is Possible</a> and <a href="https://www.feedthesecondline.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Feed the Second Line</a>. <em>– MM</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/zoom-faces-headwinds-sales-growth-slows?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zoom’s 40 Minutes of Fame Could Be Over
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zoom’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/30/zoom-zm-earnings-q2-2022.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plunging sales growth</a> is the latest sign that pandemic winners could be hitting a wall. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In its earnings call Monday, Zoom said revenue grew 54% to hit $1 billion in Q2. While that’s impressive, the company reported 191% sales growth in Q1, and 369% the quarter before that. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>When everyone was cooped up at home last year, Zoom provided a crucial lifeline for remote work, remote school, and—most cringingly—remote happy hours.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But apparently, nothing can beat the delicious awkwardness of trying to end a conversation in person. Like other pandemic-boosted companies such as Peloton, Zoom has started to lose momentum as offices reopen and people socialize IRL.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“What we’re seeing...is headwinds in our mass markets,” Zoom CFO Kelly Steckelberg told CNBC. “People are taking vacations again, they’re going to happy hours in person.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zoom’s stock fell 17% yesterday after investors got a peek into the company's post-pandemic life.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead</strong>...to sustain growth, Zoom plans to turn its software into a “destination app” that offers everything from group planning to document editing. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY LINCOLN FINANCIAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What You Do Today Matters Tomorrow
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1336236.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25555767.311397424;dc_trk_aid=504662484;dc_trk_cid=156369160;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Lincoln Financial " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=335 src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/8/k/611fb0fa6fd51.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lincoln Financial " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/8/k/611fb0fa6fd51.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This important message comes to you from the fine folks at <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1336236.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25555767.311397424;dc_trk_aid=504662484;dc_trk_cid=156369160;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lincoln Financial</a>, who are on a mission to inform people that <strong style="color:#000">financial security is about more than just retirement</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why their suite of products are here to help you live the life you want now, while also helping you plan for success in the future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It all comes down to a few questions. And don’t worry, these aren’t brain teasers:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">What are your goals and responsibilities for the future?</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">How can you protect your family?</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">How do you find extra money to pay down debt?</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">How can you plan for the retirement you want?</strong></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oh, and we should mention: You don’t even necessarily need the answers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s what <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1336236.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25555767.311397424;dc_trk_aid=504662484;dc_trk_cid=156369160;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lincoln Financial</a> is here for. They have the solutions and tools that can help you make tomorrow financially brighter and more secure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1336236.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25555767.311397424;dc_trk_aid=504662484;dc_trk_cid=156369160;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get a hold of your financial future with Lincoln Financial here</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/key-performance-indicators-september-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Since announcing its $200 surcharge on the health-care plans of unvaccinated employees, Delta Air Lines says it went from 11 workers/day receiving vaccines <a href="https://news.bloomberglaw.com/pharma-and-life-sciences/delta-workers-getting-vaccines-to-avoid-fines-top-lawyer-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to 55</a>. For the sake of debate, here’s an <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/08/27/deltas-vaccine-penalty-is-bad-idea-heres-better-one/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interesting take</a> on why Delta’s policy is a bad idea. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“They have the drive and work ethic. They get the technology. They catch on really quickly.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Heather Coleman, the operator of a McDonald’s in Medford, Oregon, wants to <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-trying-to-hire-teens-with-labor-shortage-2021-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hire your teenager</a>. Faced with a severe labor crunch, her location is hiring 14 and 15-year-old workers (yes, it’s legal), and these coachable employees have been a “blessing in disguise,” she told Insider. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/curious-case-bishop-sycamore-football-team?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Curious Case of the Bishop Sycamore Football Team
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/31/curious-case-bishop-sycamore-football-team?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Football in stitches " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzYyL2Zvb3RiYWxsX2luX3N0aXRjaGVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you heard a bunch of people making Bishop Sycamore references yesterday, here's a quick rundown of the wacky story so you can participate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a high school football game televised on ESPN on Sunday, IMG Academy walloped Bishop Sycamore 58–0. Blowouts happen at all levels of competition...but this one has completely <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/high-school/football/news/bishop-sycamore-football-controversy-eye-opening-details-emerge-after-supposed-high-schools-loss-to-img/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enraptured</a> the sports industry because it was clear to everyone involved that Bishop Sycamore had no business playing a nationally televised game against IMG, one of the top HS football programs in the country. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So how did they end up on ESPN?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The game was booked by Paragon Marketing, a firm that partners with ESPN to schedule high school sports broadcasts. According to ESPN’s commentators for the game, Bishop Sycamore said it had several D-1 prospects on its roster, but those claims couldn’t be verified. So it appears Paragon was duped into thinking this was a high-caliber team, and ESPN allowed the game to proceed despite a number of red flags.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What makes this episode particularly concerning is that putting overmatched athletes on a football field could lead to serious injuries.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So many questions remain, particularly about conditions at Bishop Sycamore, a “school” in the loosest sense of the term. Aaron Boyd, a former Bishop athlete, <a href="https://www.complex.com/sports/bishop-sycamore-high-school-player-interview/part-2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Complex</a> that players slept in a hotel for five months and “had to go rob Meijers, Krogers, Walmart because that’s the only way we can eat.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more: </strong>Read this <a href="https://awfulannouncing.com/espn/we-learned-more-about-how-bishop-sycamore-ended-up-playing-on-espn-and-its-only-getting-shadier.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deep dive</a> into what is one of the wildest sports stories of the year. <em>– NF</em></p>

src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDYwL2FsbGJpcmRzX2lsbHVzdHJhdGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBack in 2017, direct-to-consumer startups flooded your Instagram feed with pastel colors and pledges to “cut out the middleman.” Now, they’ve put on dress slacks and are marching toward Wall Street.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAllbirds, the maker of footwear that’s graced the soles of many a tech bro, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/31/shoe-maker-allbirds-files-for-ipo-and-reveals-continued-losses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. The company has made sustainability its core focus, and it plans to continue that mission by putting a green twist on the traditional IPO.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe company is conducting what it calls a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/cc0c5627-0b8e-41b8-a575-7ad94e8c13b6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSustainable Public Equity Offering\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which means it’s holding itself accountable to hit certain environmental, social, and governance (ESG) targets. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAllbirds says its supply chain has been carbon neutral since 2019, and that the carbon footprint of its standard sneakers is 30% less than those of its rivals. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as it tries to steal business from those bigger rivals—namely, Nike and Adidas—it’s worth noting that Allbirds hasn’t made money since it was founded, nor does it envision becoming profitable in the near future. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSounds familiar\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn that way, and in many others, it’s similar to Warby Parker, the e-commerce eyewear seller that \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/24/warby-parker-in-ipo-filing-reveals-rising-salesbut-also-widening-losses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e last week. Warby is also ditching the classic IPO playbook by going public via direct listing, which means it’s not actually going to raise any money in the process. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth Allbirds and Warby Parker successfully leveraged online channels to attract urban millennials comfortable with buying apparel on the internet. Allbirds’s online sales revenue grew 74% from 2018–2020, and Warby’s total sales jumped 44% over the same period.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as they’ve matured, these brands have found that brick-and-mortar locations are a necessary complement to online shopping.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWarby has opened 145 retail stores as of June 30. Allbirds has 27 and is planning on opening hundreds more. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAllbirds and Warby Parker are just a couple wildebeests in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-30/hot-ipo-market-is-tough-competition-for-consumer-hungry-buyers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebigger stampede\u003c/a\u003e of consumer-facing companies headed to the public markets. Chobani, Sweetgreen, and Roger Federer-backed On Running are all reportedly planning IPOs of their own, hoping to cash in on the strength of the US shopper. \u003cem\u003e– style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePower outages in Southern Louisiana via Entergy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince Ida made landfall as a Category 4 hurricane on Sunday, it’s left \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/08/30/1032549785/heres-the-latest-on-ida-the-tropical-storm-thrashing-the-gulf-coast?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1 million\u003c/a\u003e homes and businesses on the Gulf Coast without power. Southern Louisiana (pictured above) in particular is reeling from massive outages; it could be weeks before power is back.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The storm \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/entergy-says-2-000-miles-of-high-voltage-lines-knocked-out-by-hurricane-ida-11630370133?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrushed\u003c/a\u003e the transmission system that provides most of the energy along the coast. Entergy, a New Orleans-based energy utility, said that as of Monday, 2,000 miles of its transmission lines were out of service, and the Department of Energy said it could take up to three days to fully assess the damage and even begin to repair them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s not just phone batteries at 1% scaring officials.\u003c/strong\u003e Without power, homes, businesses, and hospitals in Mississippi and southern Louisiana don’t have safe drinking water, working fridges, or the ability to run air conditioning in the brutal 100-degree heat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLouisiana Governor John Bel Edwards \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/570201-louisiana-governor-tells-residents-not-to-return-without-ok-from?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e residents who evacuated before the storm to stay where they are—the state’s emergency systems just can’t handle them right now.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTulane University began \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.chron.com/weather/article/houston-tulane-evacuate-students-hurricane-ida-16425122.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevacuating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its students to Houston yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow you can help:\u003c/strong\u003e Donate to national orgs like \u003ca href=\"https://give.allhandsandhearts.org/give/355101/?utm_source=morning_brew#!/donation/checkout\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAll Hands and Hearts\u003c/a\u003e, or local charities like \u003ca href=\"https://anothergulf.com/ida/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAnother Gulf is Possible\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.feedthesecondline.org/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nZoom’s 40 Minutes of Fame Could Be Over\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eZoom’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/30/zoom-zm-earnings-q2-2022.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplunging sales growth\u003c/a\u003e is the latest sign that pandemic winners could be hitting a wall. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn its earnings call Monday, Zoom said revenue grew 54% to hit $1 billion in Q2. While that’s impressive, the company reported 191% sales growth in Q1, and 369% the quarter before that. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen everyone was cooped up at home last year, Zoom provided a crucial lifeline for remote work, remote school, and—most cringingly—remote happy hours.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut apparently, nothing can beat the delicious awkwardness of trying to end a conversation in person. Like other pandemic-boosted companies such as Peloton, Zoom has started to lose momentum as offices reopen and people socialize IRL.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“What we’re seeing...is headwinds in our mass markets,” Zoom CFO Kelly Steckelberg told CNBC. “People are taking vacations again, they’re going to happy hours in person.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eZoom’s stock fell 17% yesterday after investors got a peek into the company's post-pandemic life.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/strong\u003e...to sustain growth, Zoom plans to turn its software into a “destination app” that offers everything from group planning to document editing. \u003cem\u003e– SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you heard a bunch of people making Bishop Sycamore references yesterday, here's a quick rundown of the wacky story so you can participate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a high school football game televised on ESPN on Sunday, IMG Academy walloped Bishop Sycamore 58–0. Blowouts happen at all levels of competition...but this one has completely \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/high-school/football/news/bishop-sycamore-football-controversy-eye-opening-details-emerge-after-supposed-high-schools-loss-to-img/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenraptured\u003c/a\u003e the sports industry because it was clear to everyone involved that Bishop Sycamore had no business playing a nationally televised game against IMG, one of the top HS football programs in the country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo how did they end up on ESPN?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe game was booked by Paragon Marketing, a firm that partners with ESPN to schedule high school sports broadcasts. According to ESPN’s commentators for the game, Bishop Sycamore said it had several D-1 prospects on its roster, but those claims couldn’t be verified. So it appears Paragon was duped into thinking this was a high-caliber team, and ESPN allowed the game to proceed despite a number of red flags.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhat makes this episode particularly concerning is that putting overmatched athletes on a football field could lead to serious injuries.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo many questions remain, particularly about conditions at Bishop Sycamore, a “school” in the loosest sense of the term. Aaron Boyd, a former Bishop athlete, \u003ca href=\"https://www.complex.com/sports/bishop-sycamore-high-school-player-interview/part-2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Complex\u003c/a\u003e that players slept in a hotel for five months and “had to go rob Meijers, Krogers, Walmart because that’s the only way we can eat.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more: \u003c/strong\u003eRead this \u003ca href=\"https://awfulannouncing.com/espn/we-learned-more-about-how-bishop-sycamore-ended-up-playing-on-espn-and-its-only-getting-shadier.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeep dive\u003c/a\u003e into what is one of the wildest sports stories of the year. \u003cem\u003e–
